article.headline: Hofstra 70, Drexel 68
article.story: HEMPSTEAD, N.Y. (AP) -- Loren Stokes scored 20 points and Antoine Agudio finished with 19 to lead Hofstra to a 70-68 win over Drexel on Saturday, extending the Pride's home winning streak to 20 games. Stokes made nine of 13 shots and Adrian Uter had 13 points and 11 rebounds for the Pride (22-5, 14-4 Colonial Athletic Association), who trailed 37-32 at halftime and now have the second-longest home win streak in the nation behind Gonzaga. Frank Elegar came off the bench to score 15 points for the Dragons (15-15, 8-10), who lost their eighth straight road game. Bashir Mason had 14 points and Dominick Mejia added 12. Uter scored six points in an 18-1 run that gave Hofstra a 50-38 lead with 14:10 left in the second half. Drexel put together a 10-0 run to get within 68-67 with 45 seconds to play. Tramayne Hawthorne, who had five points, finished off the surge with a three-point play. Greg Johnson's two foul shots gave Hofstra a 70-67 lead with 12 seconds to go. Mejia then made the first of two free throws with 3 seconds remaining and missed the second intentionally. Mason grabbed the rebound but his 3-pointer bounced off the rim at the buzzer.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
